title: aircraft n numbers
author: 2 Piece

comments.content:
Could be 'Semi Round', official FAA font for aircraft registration numbers.  
See [here](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317073423/http:/www.aerographics.com/images/documents/AeroGraphics_Semi-Round_Registration_Font.pdf) for sample (PDF).

If you want a digital version you might try one made by bladerunner900 and posted to The A2A Simulations Community on Jan 27, 2014 as "AviationSemi-Roundstraight" [http://a2asimulations.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=98&t=38435](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317073423/http:/a2asimulations.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=98&t=38435 "http://a2asimulations.com/forum/viewtopic.php?f=98&t=38435")  
Don

BTW did you notice that the version in your image seems to be sloped 15 or 20 degrees left. Compare the \_N\_ to the row of rivets. Sloped aviation fonts are discussed on the page I linked to in my previous post.  
Don
